website_summaries.verdict: A sound option for athletes, but these socks might not be practical for all consumers who require compression.
pros: Patented graduated compression is ideal for athletes
Unique Silver Drystat stops bacteria growth
cons: Fit loosely compared to others and might not provide the best compression for everyday wear

customer_reviews.title: No Compression...You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: There is little if any compression...I am a distance runner and bought these for the compression, not because I needed gym socks. I would return them but I can not find the package they came in. I tired them on and have not even worn them. Money wasted. I bought these based on Amazon reviews....I am assuming that the previous purchasers either have never had real compression socks or are not running in them. I was trying to not pay $30+ a pair for compression socks but you obviously get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: CamilleDione

customer_reviews.title: Not made for the people who need them...
customer_reviews.text: I have swollen legs. It's why I need compression socks (duh!). So, why don't they make these to fit people with swollen legs or wide calves and ankles? If I had super skinny legs, I wouldn't really need compression socks. These are not made for people who suffer from edema. They are made for extremely physically fit and/or skinny people who need to take a flight or long car ride. For actual compression socks made for people with edema, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: V.Raj

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Fit
customer_reviews.text: This is my second time reviewing this product. The first time I was mildly vexed and the pickers of nit at Amazon were offended by my mildly harsh language. I ordered X-large and received large, perhaps the people at order fulfillment do not understand the difference. For them I will make it plain, it is like being promised a paycheck and receiving a two-for-one coupon at McDonalds. I cannot attest to the quality of the product as it doesn't ####### go on my foot or leg I hope Jeff Bezos, the god king of Amazon gets the word.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Lancaster

customer_reviews.title: Great for medical professionals
customer_reviews.text: I've had this product for almost a year. Overall, I would say these are great compression socks! I personally prefer a higher degree of compression, which these socks have. I work in the medical field and am on my feet a lot during my shifts. I definitely can tell the difference at the end of the day wearing these socks. My feet and legs would always get sore after a long shift before I started wearing these socks. In terms of product quality and longevity, I am just a little disappointed that the heels of them are starting to wear thin already and relatively speaking, I haven't worn these a ton.
customer_reviews.author: KLPNP15

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: At first I thought these were going to be too tight, so I didn't open the package for a long time. Finally, I needed some more compression socks and gave them a try. I'm a short (5'2") female and my calves are fairly large, but they worked better than my others to keep the edema reduced at my ankles. They also didn't pinch much at the knee level, were comfortable to wear, and not too thick for my shoes. Overall, I highly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: sweetartcat

customer_reviews.title: Not A Fashion Statement
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to help me in my quest for developing a love for running. It didn't work, but it wasn't the socks' fault. The socks did what they were supposed to do (compress my legs), but I gave up on running due to a multitude of foot pains that no magic socks could cure. And, they didn't go with anything I wore to exercise. Imagine a middle-aged fat woman in black spandex and long white socks...not a pretty picture. However, I my legs felt more supported, my feet seemed to stay dry (in hot Florida), and they might have provided slightly more comfort than normal socks (but I'm not 100% certain about that last claim).
customer_reviews.author: Curlyconch

customer_reviews.title: Consider when in the lifetime of the sock the compression is measured.
customer_reviews.text: I sized these based on shoe size. Initially they were difficult to put on. After the 4th or 5th time, however, I could almost pull them on like a regular pair of socks. It's not clear to me whether any of these graduated compression socks which claim 12-20mm Hg measure that "out of the box" or after some measure of average usage or lifetime. So while they certainly fit my size 10 foot, on a subsequent purchase, I chose a size lower, and it felt more effective. So if you're at the lower half of the advertised size range, choose the smaller size.
customer_reviews.author: R. Fritz

customer_reviews.title: Colorful socks NOT compression socks
customer_reviews.text: These are not graduated compression socks... they could not compress a bag of chips. Also note the bizarre sizing on packaging... so what actually supposedly Fits.. a 12.5 US... when a UK equivalent is 11.5. Yet one is XL and one is L - I got the L and there’s no compression sock quality
customer_reviews.author: Harley Rider

customer_reviews.title: No More Shin Splints
customer_reviews.text: I love these socks. I am very prone to shin splints, but since a friend told me about compression socks, I have never had them again. These have been great socks, they fit nice and tight and they don't fall. I wear them for 3-4 runs before I wash them, they never stink and they never get loose. They wick the water away as well. I have put roughly 160 miles on these socks according to my run diary so they definitely last.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Z

customer_reviews.title: the best
customer_reviews.text: I have many compression socks...have been using them for years....these are the best you can buy and the price is unbelievable...I have paid as much as 35 a pair...they are good but not better than these Italian made and rinsed and smell free...ready to wear...no I'm not paid..just sharing news of a wonderful product...buying more immediately..I wear 12 shoe and have slender feet the large works great for me...do get yourself a wire rack for donning compression socks..I think here on amazon...it saves your back and make it a simple task to put them on...good luck.
customer_reviews.author: Gypsyjoe  DiPasquale

customer_reviews.title: These are the best!! I own 4 pairs
customer_reviews.text: These are the best!! I own 4 pairs. I work in surgery and I am on my feet standing or walking all day long. I have told many others about these. I am not a fan of anything taller than knee highs. I know whenI wear these I feel better, I have less low backpain from leg fatigue. I would recommend these to anyone who needs compression or stands for a living. The size guide will help you pick the correct compression. I do not put mine into the dryer. They have been washed so many times and still do the job. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: jana

customer_reviews.title: Serious shrinkage!
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable. Not at all moisture wicking. Feet get hot and sweaty in these but they do help circulation. Even after standing all day, my feet are not swollen. I bought 10 pairs of these, and they've shrunk SIGNIFICANTLY in the year I've been using them. The photo shows two pairs of medium socks, new pair on the left, older pair on the right after about a year of light use (each pair used once and washed, about every other week) and approximately 20 washes.
customer_reviews.author: CatMum

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: These really are not bad. Padding in the foot area is very good. I e design, calf muscle feels good during and after wearing. Unfortunately for me, one fit great but the other slips down a quarter of the way after an hour Other pairs I have from other manufactures, this does not happen. Haven’t contacted seller. I thought after the first washing or two it would have changed but it did not, since I have them I wear them until it starts to slip down further, had very high hopes based on all the other reviews
customer_reviews.author: Marty3

customer_reviews.title: Works for me.
customer_reviews.text: These socks work pretty good. They keep my ankles from swelling after a long shift and are easy to care for. The only reason I deducted a star is for the smell. It's minor I know, but I can't get the smell out even after several washings and air dryings. To my sensitive nose, it smells as if the socks are infused with dryer sheets. I know, but it is strong and won't go away. Otherwise, the socks really do work quite well and seem to last a fair amount of time. I will continue to purchase these and would recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: luebTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Lost calf compression by the end of the day
customer_reviews.text: I have worn and purchased Vitalsox in the past and loved them. I purchased this style because it had less design and stitching up the side of the leg (Italian Vitalsox woman’s). I was a little disappointed with the sizing. I wore them to work (ER nurse) and noticed that they didn’t provide as much compression around the calf at the end of the day.
customer_reviews.author: NatS

customer_reviews.title: Great socks for traveling
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my wife for flights and travel. She always ends up with swollen ankles after flying and it takes days for the swelling to go down. But after wearing these socks, she no longer has any swelling problems in the ankles. They can be tricky to get on because the stretch is so tight (which is a good thing), but once you get the feet in, you can roll the rest of the way. My wife also has very small feel (size 6.5) and has a lot of trouble finding small socks that fit properly. The XS size is perfect for her. She doesn't fly without these socks!
customer_reviews.author: savydavy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I'm 73 years old; however more like 60's; anyway work out regularly; I have last year, ordered various compression socks; due to a DVT blood clot. Yep its gone! Anyway this sock is in my opinion superior to any of the other compression socks I tried. Proof: I recently ordered two more (which I received quickly); and I have 3 other pairs from the same manufacture, which apparently made in Italy., So; if you believe you want compression socks for whatever reason; these are the BEST. Rick Tucson
customer_reviews.author: Rick Abrams

customer_reviews.title: Great socks. Worth the investment.
customer_reviews.text: You may be asking yourself WHY? Athletics or not these are great socks in general. They're even better than dress socks for work in my opinion (Those seem like they're meant to rip quickly and are EXPENSIVE!$$) I've had some problems with other socks cutting off the circulation to my calfs. I tore my calf while sprinting once and it took a little over a year to get my calf back to normal. These give great support and comfort. I don't have problems with my foot going to sleep when sitting down because the socks are not too tight.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Moncayo

customer_reviews.title: Quality! Straight up.
customer_reviews.text: Great compression socks. Nice padding on the bottom of the socks. Yeah, they seem to be worth the money. Time will tell. Nice colors. You will learn the tricks to putting compression socks on. Clip your fingernails 😸 Here's the thing....as you start to wear them it becomes obvious just how well engineered these Sox really are. I would buy them again. It's a good idea to turn these Sox inside out every other wash to wash out the dried skin cells and such. Water doesn't move through like conventional Sox.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: excellent socks for diabetics
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my boyfriend who is a dietetics, and he claims they are the best compression socks he was ever worn. They were a little bit of a struggle to put on the first time as there tight until they get a little stretched. He defiantly noticed the improvement with his leg pains and he said they stayed tight and didn't completely stretch out like other brands. He like these so much I was forced to get him a few more pairs. The only think about these sock is they are expensive for a pair but well worth it if your a diabetic
customer_reviews.author: Miss. Fitts

customer_reviews.title: Cuts Off Blood Flow
customer_reviews.text: These socks are TOO tight at the top three to four inches. The socks cause tremendous discomfort near the top, The socks are very well made, but I strongly recommend that no one purchase these socks until the construction problems are corrected.
customer_reviews.author: Lafell Jamall

customer_reviews.title: Worked Well At First
customer_reviews.text: Let me start by saying I put these under heavy use, so my case may be a bit out of the ordinary. I got these socks on September 12th, and they worked wonderfully for about two weeks. Walking on average about 10 miles a day and a few hikes here and there, I actually did feel they helped my recovery times and they felt far more comfortable than anything else I have tried as far as compression socks go. However, for the past couple days I have noticed that they feel oddly loose, and they no longer offer the same benefits as they previously did. They are very good socks though, so I might end up buying a new pair.
customer_reviews.author: Raegan Smith

customer_reviews.title: High quality compression socks
customer_reviews.text: My husband is diabetic and needs compression socks. I have purchased six pair of these for him over the past couple of years. I have purchased other brands that were less expensive but they ended up being of lesser quality or too short for his legs. I can count on Vitalsox to be the correct size, have high quality compression features, and hold up to frequent washing. (I do not use chlorine bleach or put them in the dryer. They air dry very quickly.)
customer_reviews.author: Mystilli

customer_reviews.title: Well made compression socks
customer_reviews.text: I wear these socks, along with several other brands, for vein support. I like this brand because my legs seem to feel better at the end of the day despite being of lower compression. My doctor is great and a highly respected vascular surgeon, but he feels these socks don't put enough pressure on my legs. I respect his opinion, but will maintain that how my legs feel is the critical measure of effectiveness of me. I think the progressive compression can be more effective for some situations.
customer_reviews.author: K. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Not true to size
customer_reviews.text: Try these on as soon as received. I did not until today - 10 days after the return date closed. Although the order was for small, these are significantly larger than the previous pairs I have ordered. Since all the previous socks fit consistently, I did not expect these to be different. And since these are pinkish, I probably can't pass them on to my grandson to wear with his scrubs. They are significantly longer than other smalls, and provide minimal compression.
customer_reviews.author: G. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Easy on,  easy off
customer_reviews.text: If you properly pull the wrong foot side through, put that part of the sock on, the rest is very easy. Just pull some, stop pull the heal over the bottom and pull the rest up. Nicest, prettiest socks to own. Comfortable. I wear them when it’s quite warm outside. I’m happy. I own the red, pink, lime green, blue and tan. As long as I have to wear them, I keep in style and do get compliments on them.
customer_reviews.author: lBJean

customer_reviews.title: A life saver for air travel
customer_reviews.text: I bought these socks for the 15 hour long flight from the US to Australia. They made an AMAZING difference. I used to suffer from severe discomfort on the airplane, when after a couple of hours you can't wait to get out of the seat, stretch your legs, elevate your feet, and the whole body just hurts. Well, with these socks I didn't get any of that pain. It was my 3rd trip to Australia and the easiest one! Get them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Design flawed
customer_reviews.text: Design flaw--Wherever there is added design, such as a change in color, added new yarn, left an impression in my leg. the sole of my feet hurt so bad, that I had to remove the socks. I couldn't believe this until I remove the sock , and the impressions were the places that hurt the most.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas A. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, yet firm fitting
customer_reviews.text: I ordered Vitalsox Italy-Patented Compression Socks (for Men) over two months ahead of planned international travel. Having tried them on for fit ahead of the lengthy flights ahead, I can say that they feel comfortable, yet firm fitting. They should be just fine for their intended use.
customer_reviews.author: Charles A. Leech, III

customer_reviews.title: perfect
customer_reviews.text: I get the occasional venous restrictions, with swelling. My doctor recommended that I purchase compression socks at the medical complex's store. When I saw the price - I saw the dollars flying into the insurance corporations. Bought these, worked great. A bit of technique is required to put them on, but the relief is outstanding. I wear these sitting, standing, walking when needed. I don't use them for sleeping, when the blood pressure drops I find they can become overly constricting.
customer_reviews.author: count210

customer_reviews.title: Not for those who have weak hands
customer_reviews.text: These are great; they're long enough, and fit really well. Seem to be well made, too. A little heavy for me for summer wear, so they're going in the drawer until the weather gets cooler. I really struggled with putting these on, and if my hands were any weaker I couldn't have done it. The resulting support is worth the effort, no doubt about it, but I think those with very poor hand control might simply be unable to put them on.
customer_reviews.author: Granny Llyn

customer_reviews.title: Compression Socks for Broomsticks?
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know who these were made for but; they’re definitely not for me. They seem to be made from nice materials and would probably be comfortable IF I could get them on. They are so narrow that I cannot fit my hand inside them, let alone a foot, ankle and calf. They are not tapered like other compression socks that I’ve purchased. Seem to be designed for broomsticks rather than humans. They are going back.
customer_reviews.author: StoneOld

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite socks!
customer_reviews.text: Love these! The compression level, thickness of the material, and durability are great. Definitely feel the difference between when I wear them or not, on a 10-hr hospital shift. I am needing to order a few more pairs, since I have to keep washing them too often, or wear regular ankle socks. The thickness is perfect for almost-always sunny San Diego. I don't like the super thick compression socks, they make my legs sweaty and itchy. This sock is relatively thin, but a durable and effective kind of thin. I bought three other brands to compare, and these are one of my top picks. LOVE!
customer_reviews.author: SalseraOn2RN

customer_reviews.title: Terrible - compression doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for 3 runs - I thought I loved them, but by the third wash they had lost all "compression" above the ankle. Now they just fall down. I won't be wearing them for running ever again because as far as normal socks go, they don't offer any cushion. I have a pair of smartwool compression socks that are 2+ years old and still working pretty well. Looks like I'll be switching back to those.
customer_reviews.author: JMil

customer_reviews.title: I really like these socks
customer_reviews.text: I really like these socks! I have struggled with self diagnosed plantar fasciitis for many years and have begun using a combination of foam rolling, trigger point therapy, and compression socks and my feet feel better than ever. I also wear them while motorcycle touring and they feel great, and wick moisture well. I wear a size 10.5 and found the medium to fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Stockie

customer_reviews.title: Awesome socks!
customer_reviews.text: Just started training for a half marathon and had several runners recommend them to me. After my husband saw how much better I felt with these on my feet, he went and got a pair too. I'm a larger woman with larger feet. Although by the size standards on the picture they would recommend I get a medium, I got a large and they fit perfectly. You want these to be tight, but not cutting off your circulation. These definitely helped alleviate blistering and calf pain during longer runs. They're a pain in the butt to get on, but so are any clothing item that is so form fitting!
customer_reviews.author: Sazzle

customer_reviews.title: Great for Increased Blood Flow
customer_reviews.text: I can feel the difference when I wear these - whether during or after exercise. Less fatigue and pain, and I think I sleep better after having worn them. Minus one star for durability of product. I have worn these about 10-15 times, washing after every 2 wears, and they're already showing signs of stretching and damage - even some holes in the sole. It could be that this is the nature of such a product, but it doesn't feel like I've fully gotten my money's worth yet.
customer_reviews.author: the_bg

customer_reviews.title: Size XL is extra long, but not XL.
customer_reviews.text: Website size description for XL indicates a fit for my shoe size and calf width: not true. Could not get one sock on, it's that tight. Can't rate moisture wicking, 'cause I did not wear 'em. If the manufacturer redesigns the size to fit, the sock sounds like it's unique. But, as is, no. Sock needs to be significantly wider AND shorter: it's way too long, & I'm six foot tall.
customer_reviews.author: Sebastian Mudry

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a winner
customer_reviews.text: Loved the way this compression sock feels on my entire leg. Usually I have major pain during and more after jogging. My legs tend to swell after and at night. These sock helped me recover quicker after and I even felt the support in action as I jogged and my legs started to fatigue. The support mechanism and warmth while jogging began to help keep me going. AND...No swelling after either, which was the major plus for me. Would definitely buy again, only thing was that when I opened the package, one sock had loose stitching at the toe.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality compression socks
customer_reviews.text: This was the 4th pair that I've bought! As a nurse, I'm on my feet at least 12 hrs a day. These hug my legs and keep them from feeling "tired". Great quality compression socks! The underside of the feet area are actually padded - love it!
customer_reviews.author: Lesa

customer_reviews.title: Odor control
customer_reviews.text: I own two pairs of these socks that I wear to work as a nurse on a busy med-surg floor. I realized recently that the actual mmHg of these are lower than what I probably need. That being said, for what they are, they do a great job. I like the thicker material of the sock and the graduated compression. The best part of these socks which I cannot find elsewhere in the 20-30 mmHg range or thigh-highs, is the odor control from the silver drysat. Regular compression socks get so smelly especially when paired with the hot box of a clog-style non-slip shoe. I have not had any problems with these!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas & Liane

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Ran a half marathon in them, works great and no soreness after. I like that they are long and come all the way up to my knees. Also they don't slip and don't wear out fast. It looks a little silly with the arrows going up your leg. Like a "this side up" sign, hahaha. But that's just looks, they work great. Update 2016, a year later: I just wore these again and I don't know if it's me or I got fat but they seemed tight. I know it's compression, but look at the pic, the stitching where the arrow and insignia are and elastic on the top left indentations on my leg.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonConcierge

customer_reviews.title: Irregular just like the Chinese
customer_reviews.text: As my experience with the many made-in-China compression socks, the Chinese and Italians must think Americans are giants. I am 5'9 170# size 9 men's shoe and a Medium sock from these people places the heal midway up my calf, and the sock rises midway up my thigh as if a stocking and not men's sock. I'd not even expect a large sock to be that large.
customer_reviews.author: RocketCityChas

customer_reviews.title: pretty good about trapping odor too
customer_reviews.text: i wear them whenever i know i have to stand for hours on end. it reduces the swelling significantly and provides little extra cushioning for my feet. pretty good about trapping odor too. i did have some indents but not sure if that was more the swelling or the socks themselves. other than that, cheaper-average costwise for the quality.
customer_reviews.author: borg

customer_reviews.title: my daughter the nurse gives them a thumbs up
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair for my daughter who is an ER nurse and on her feet for 12 hour shifts. Her initial though was that with the markings up the back they looked like my grandson's athletic socks. I told her that a number of nurses wrote positive reviews on these compression socks. So she's worn them a couple of times, they have been washed twice and hung to dry. They stay up and she's indicated that she'd like another pair, which I take to mean "she likes them". They seemed fairly expensive but worth it if they do the job and last. Will report back once she's used them for a couple of months.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Ann

customer_reviews.title: good for light training but not competition
customer_reviews.text: The quality of these socks is good, the price is reasonable, and they fit well. There are also a large number of color choices, and they are relatively durable. All of which is great. What they don't have is adequate compression, at least in my view. I wear them for workouts, but I don't find them suitable for competitive OCR events. They simply do not have the same level of compression as the more expensive Mudgear, Swiftwick etc brands I generally wear.
customer_reviews.author: Pelle Schultz

customer_reviews.title: Fits well, firm support without being tight
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these to wear during long flights, or lots of sitting to help prevent another DVT. I was between sizes according to the chart so I ordered up. These fit good and provide firm compression. I had no issues with the band at the top restricting more than the sock leg and the length on the XL was good (I am 6' tall male).
customer_reviews.author: NKC, MO

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Compression Socks
customer_reviews.text: These have been my favorite(*) compression socks for a while, I now have 4 pair. They are very snug in the calf, which is what one wants, but comfortably relaxed in the foot, which works well for me. On me they are long enough to reach above my calf, nearly to the knee, but not so much that there is extra material. I usually wear the black ones, but the other colors are good sometimes. (*) I recently purchased a pair of the ABD "Premium Compression Socks" and also like them very much. They seem to be even a bit more snug than these Vitalsox.
customer_reviews.author: Chip C

customer_reviews.title: These work well and feel great. I got a pair of the Go2 socks ...
customer_reviews.text: Critical care nurse and on my feet for most of a 12 hour shift. I started noticing an increase in the spider veins in my feet/ankles and decided I should invest in some compression socks. These work well and feel great. I got a pair of the Go2 socks at the same time and they are a little too tight for my comfort. Just bought another set of these a few days ago :)
customer_reviews.author: Jason S. Wathey

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Stand a lot at work and do a ton of weekend hiking so I thought I'd take a chance and try these out. Amazing difference at the end of the day! Sorry I didn't know about these years ago. Such a simple concept to make such a difference. Recovery time is half as much and don't feel the usual lead leg at the end of an active day.
customer_reviews.author: Bergsteiger

customer_reviews.title: Good socks for elderly mother
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my 85 year old mother with poor circulation. I've gone through many pairs of compression socks these are her favorites. The main reason is it is a closed toe and the compression is not too tight. Some of the socks are so tight that she has had to stop in a store to have help in removing them. The purpose of the socks in aiding the circulation will not take place if the user is in more pain that they perceive the benefit. This was often the case with other brands but she likes these so they are highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Porter

customer_reviews.title: Way to small too narrow to slender
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband he needed it for leg problems. He could not even get them onto his feet. It wouldn’t Pull onto the foot. Way way too narrow and small These are for kids. Not Men 200 pounds 6”1
customer_reviews.author: C. A. Barotti

customer_reviews.title: Not made for people under 6'1".
customer_reviews.text: Nice socks but if you're not tall - 6 foot + - they will not fit. I'm 5'10" with muscular legs, and the distance from floor to just below me knee is 17". I have to roll the tops over 2" so the tops do not cover my knees. If the distance from floor to just below your knee is less than 19" or 20", these socks will be too big. Nice sock but disappointed that tje fit is definitely for taller people.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Used socks
customer_reviews.text: I’ve purchased these socks in the past and absolutely loved them. One of my pairs just wore out after 6 years, so time to order another pair. When these arrived I could tell they were not new due to the packaging. When I took them out of the package, they had white animal hair all over them. Needless to say, I was very disappointed and will be returning them. I’m hoping I can find a different seller, because I do love the socks themselves.
customer_reviews.author: Micki Crispin

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic calf length compression socks.
customer_reviews.text: These were the compression socks that started me off. Having bought cheap compression socks locally, I decided to invest in these Italian socks and I haven't regretted my decision. These are great socks and live up to the description. When I go on long trips in the car, standing on my feet for a long time, or walking/running, my legs feel so much better! The Drystat does a great job keeping the moisture and odor at bay. I've washed these a number of times and they continue to hold their size. Vitasox continues to be my favorite compression sock manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph

customer_reviews.title: Great compression socks for long flights!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these to keep my ankles from swelling during long flights and they exceeded my expectations! They were very snug and slightly difficult to put on but my feet were very comfortable (good sizing and no weird seams) and my legs didn't get all itchy after wearing them for 10 hours. First time I haven't had sore "pins and needles" feet after an international flight. I'm fit and healthy but my family has a history of circulation issues so I thought I'd try these. So glad I did!
customer_reviews.author: cgo

customer_reviews.title: Don't keep this secret to yourself
customer_reviews.text: Discovering these amazing compression socks that comfort my old legs and protect them from heart problems took second place behind sharing them as gifts to my athletic kids and grandchildren. I've had some of these socks for over three years and they are just as good as new--they hold me together and every thread is in tact.
customer_reviews.author: zeke

customer_reviews.title: My favorite socks so far.
customer_reviews.text: I was in an accident last year and had to start wearing these socks after my surgery. They are fantastic, and my surgeon even ordered a pait after he saw mine. I bought several different so far and just ordered 2 more pairs of these so I could have more since I like them the best. Pros: I have not lost any elasticity from wearing and washing them. No tears compared to other socks I bought at the same time. They are full length sock that pulls up high to below the knee, so perfect if you like that. They have so far helped with my recovery and pt. Cons: I just wish there were more color choices.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Best ever!
customer_reviews.text: The BEST compression socks I have tried. I have several pairs and have warn them out; these are my new babies!!! So soft and comfortable AND the compression is excellent! Great for working out - fast walking/running. I even wear them daily at work (desk job). Have a hard time not wearing them as they are that comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: Ann L. Whipple

customer_reviews.title: Great when new, less so after extended use.
customer_reviews.text: When new, the socks have very strong elastic and work well to relieve leg pain. They can be a challenge to put on because of the strong elasticity. However, after a few weeks of wear and several times through the clothes washer, they stretch and loose some of their elasticity. The upside is that they are much easier to put on. The socks are made well and worth buying, but be aware that they get loose after regular use.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Pan

customer_reviews.title: Invigorating
customer_reviews.text: Last winter I started buying a bunch of different compression socks from Amazon to try to find the right ones for me. These Vitalsox are by far my favorite, one year down the road. They have not lost their compression or their shape and they hold up well with frequent washing. I have not had any problems with pilling. My legs notice a huge difference after standing up for hours at work. I like the gray markings on the socks because it makes it easier to find them in a sea of non compression black socks laundry. I will definitely buy more.
customer_reviews.author: christyr

customer_reviews.title: Great support stockings.
customer_reviews.text: I can wear these all day and the compression eliminates the foot and leg fatigue. I will buy more of these. These compression stockings are very effective at controlling blood circulation as gravity can cause swollen ankles and feet, which leads to aching and fatigue by the end of a workday.
customer_reviews.author: Thos. Jefferson

customer_reviews.title: Complete Compression
customer_reviews.text: These compression socks are by far the best out there. Quality all around. Soft material but great compression. Look no further for compression socks. No more pain in my arch, ankle or calf. Size chart suggested medium, but I ordered one medium and one large. Honestly, they both fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Biagio C.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing quality and feel!!
customer_reviews.text: I feel like almost a duty to write this review! I bought this socks shortly after my surgery for pttd tendon transfer surgery with calcaneal osteotomy, and it helped beyond words with the healing and swelling. It is my go to sock when need it for support. Well made and no complaints whatsoever. For those who complain about how hard is to put it on, sorry, I don't think you tried hard enough. It's compression for a reason!
customer_reviews.author: Romanian bison. Lol!

customer_reviews.title: GREAT SOCKS
customer_reviews.text: I am recovering from a broken leg. the socks work great for compression. At the end of the day my legs feel great. they are a little tight around the upper calf ,but I do work out and have larger calves. I got 4 pair and they hold up well in the wash without stretching out at the top.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Shepard

customer_reviews.title: These Compression socks are awesome. I am on my feet a lot
customer_reviews.text: These Compression socks are awesome. I am on my feet a lot, and I have to wear heavy Steel Toed Boots, and my legs were always aching at the end of my shift. I tried these on the advice of a co worker, and I read a lot of reviews before I bought these. I am glad I did. They fit as expected even though I have very large Calves, and they hold up real well to a lot of washings, and keep their shape. I recommend them highly.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Ferris

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent Quality
customer_reviews.text: Great socks. Used these for a long plane ride to keep leg circulation going. Legs felt fresh after a long flight. UPDATE: I purchased another 2 sets of these socks after using the other pair for a year. The new socks do not come up as far on the leg (old socks came up to almost the bottom of my knee) and are rather loose and keep sliding down my leg (old socks stayed put and were very tight). Amazon apparently doesn't let me write a brand new review even though I've purchased more of the same item so at this point I wouldn't buy these socks again.
customer_reviews.author: barnyard

customer_reviews.title: Gross refurb
customer_reviews.text: Got sent out a pair that had been used. Unbelievable. Opening the wrinkled zip log baggie I pulled out a pair of socks that had been worn so much that the top part was wrinkled like they had been on a patient that couldn't pull them up for a long time. They also REEKED of fabric softener. Who ships scented socks. Passing on this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Grogansgoat

customer_reviews.title: good calf, big sock.
customer_reviews.text: Ok so I just got these. I'm going to run a half marathon in 3 days. I was thinking of wearing these and ordered them. I received them today- I got a small. I'm 5'1" 120 lbs and wear a 7.5 shoe, female. I'm wearing them now, my calves feel awesome, but they are a bit large on my feet, so I don't know if I could wear them during the run without risking discomfort or blisters.
customer_reviews.author: Katey

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: Nice and good value for my purchase price, but they are hot! Really, that’s my only complaint! I don’t think that can be avoided, though. If you are used to wearing heavy and long socks anyway, then I say go for it. All compression socks, by design, are difficult to put on, but these are quality made, and and I ordered based on the measurement recommendations and they fit fine.
customer_reviews.author: cathy timbs

customer_reviews.title: Active socks for helping blood flow
customer_reviews.text: If you are very active using your legs or possible you sit too much and find your lower legs swell some these socks seemed to really help my problem. I would be working Remodeling my home and spent a lot of time going up and down ladders. These seemed to help me. Read this company's website. They have been making sports socks for a long time. Interesting to watch some of their videos. ..... BTW there are many other types out there but this company sold me.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Compression socks for long flights
customer_reviews.text: I used them twice already on a 9+ hour flights. The socks were excellent! My legs and feet felt pretty good, compared to times I have not sure compression socks. I also used them for work too, no complains. What I really like about these socks is they aren't hard to put on or take off and they feel great. The bright orange color does make for good conversations and even stares.
customer_reviews.author: Zero

customer_reviews.title: If You Have Large Calves...
customer_reviews.text: If you have large calves, you will never be able to pull these socks up. I ordered the XL size, but there was no way I was ever going to get the sock pulled up over my calves. I do have to say, though, that the socks appear to be well made and high quality. The feel of the material is nice. Just wish I could wear them!
customer_reviews.author: J. Vaughn

customer_reviews.title: Takes the pressure of my legs.
customer_reviews.text: As I am suffering from heart failure, my doctor told me to start wearing compression socks. These things are great! Some days I wake up, and the skin on my legs feels tight. I slap a pair of these on, and within an hour I realize the tightness is gone. These socks are a great solution to a physical need.
customer_reviews.author: WW-Long Island

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend these socks
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these for 3 months. The compression is very helpful when running, standing for long periods, or sitting as on a plane. I initially bought them because I had broken my ankle and had some swelling for a few months after ward as I recovered. These really helped reduce swelling, and I continue to use these socks for running and hiking. It is worth the extra cost over other cheaper brands that don't really have the structure necessary. I recommend watching a video no YouTube on how to put these socks on, otherwise you will struggle. Once you know how, it is simple.
customer_reviews.author: Dale Kerrigan

customer_reviews.title: When is a medium not a medium?
customer_reviews.text: I liked my first pair of Vitalsox so much that I bought a second pair. Unfortunately the sizing on the second pair was no where near a medium as you can see for yourself. I'm going to order more compression socks but probably not from this vendor.
customer_reviews.author: Landau Cowrecian

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my legs comfortable all year.
customer_reviews.text: I just bought two more after being so satisfied with the first pair. I can comfortably wear them year round, even summer in Phoenix. I have them primarily to wear under my scrubs at work but have used them on hikes and walking during vacations. They keep their shape for very long, machine wash cold but I do not use the dryer, they look like new.
customer_reviews.author: klo

customer_reviews.title: Good sock if you get the right size.
customer_reviews.text: Work as they are supposed to once I got a good size. Comfortable and no slipping/drooping. This is my 2nd pair as I returned the 1st for being too large. I wear a size 10.5 to 11 (US) (manufacturer dependent) and initially ordered the Large sock, judging from the size chart of the front page. When I 1st tried the Larges on the 'heel cup' came back far enough to come over the back of the heel and about 1" up the back of the leg. I returned them and replaced with a size MED. These fit perfectly. ** This is my 1st pair of compression socks so I can not compare to other makes/manufacturers.
customer_reviews.author: Just a guy

customer_reviews.title: Way too long!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these compression socks for me and my boyfriend for longer air travel. I used the size chart and ordered accordingly. I ordered him XL and me a Medium pair. These socks went up over our knees. On me, the heel of the sock was up behind my ankle. I returned them.
customer_reviews.author: L. Dinsmore

customer_reviews.title: Great compression, but hard to get on and runs small
customer_reviews.text: If you have small feet and calves, these socks may work great for you. Unfortunately for me, they just didn't really work out. I found the socks extremely hard to get on. In general, compression socks aren't easy to get on (or they wouldn't work) but I really struggled with these. They did stretch, but not much at all. I was able to get them on, but they were uncomfortable fairly quickly because they were so constricting in my legs. They do work decently well to prevent swelling, but you really need small legs and feet to take advantage of these socks.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer L. Gorczynski

customer_reviews.title: Long time user
customer_reviews.text: Just bought my third pair, have been wearing for frequent business travel last four years and they have been great, can really feel difference. Wish they were eligible for FSA claim though. IRS guide says "Compression socks rated at 30-40 mmHg or above that are used to treat a medical condition are eligible with a flexible spending account (FSA), health savings account (HSA) or health reimbursement arrangement (HRA). Compression socks are not eligible for reimbursement with a limited care flexible spending account (LCFSA) and dependent care flexible spending accounts (DCFSA)."
customer_reviews.author: LifeWarrior

customer_reviews.title: It really feels like a quality compression sock, it extends perfectly up to below my knee.
customer_reviews.text: Just a bit easier to put on and take off than the competitors compression sock. I ordered one in black and I'll probably order another in white. I have a size 13 foot, and even though the foot portion is much smaller, it stretches enough to cover the foot and extends up to my knee, so it doesn't cut circulation off in the calf.
customer_reviews.author: fiddlewaltzer

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my legs from swelling up
customer_reviews.text: I use these on every plane ride and when I'm at work. My job keeps me standing up for 10 to 12 hours a shift. These keep my legs feeling fresh. My legs don't swell up like the do when I don't wear them. They are especially useful on long plane rides. I get off a plane now and feel like I can run a 10K!
customer_reviews.author: Ya-Man

customer_reviews.title: Felt comfortable and worked!
customer_reviews.text: Socks were a good quality. Used them for a tough mudder and they held up well. Compression was good. I wear a size 13 shoe and purchased a medium (i dont have overly large calfs but do run). I felt like this was adequate compression for what they are supposed to be.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: If your calves measure 16" in circumference (or more), I strongly recommend size XL of this sock.
customer_reviews.text: If your calves measure 16" in circumference (or more), I strongly recommend size XL of this sock. I have purchased other compression socks, but when my legs swelled out to 18" due to water retention, these other socks became very tight and unbearable to wear. These Vitasox fit well, and their construction aided a great deal in getting my calves back to 16" (and the loss of about 20 lbs.). I don't recommend this, but I accidentally ran these socks through the dryer, and they did not shrink or lose elasticity. In summary, these are the only compression socks that I plan on wearing in the future
customer_reviews.author: Floating Apex

customer_reviews.title: Great for long 13 hour shifts and recovery after running 16+ miles.
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a compression sock to wear to work (I'm an RN on my feet for 13 hour shifts). Love these. Perfect padding in the foot, a little long, but great compression. I bought 2 more for all my shifts. Starting wearing them after my long endurance runs (16+ miles) and they really do help with recovery! I go from painful penguin walking (from stiffness) to walking normal after a run. I actually can't wait to shower and put them on after a run! Will try running in them but haven't yet. Even my boyfriend loves them (and he put up a good fight to never wear compression socks!). He's on his 3rd pair :)))
customer_reviews.author: KayKay

customer_reviews.title: great socks for running.
customer_reviews.text: bought these to run a half marathon after getting shin splints 2 weeks before the race. focused on no running and exercising on the elliptical to not aggravate my shin. these socks fit well and didn't chafe, cause blisters, or any issues. I didn't feel shin splints during my run and my legs felt great post race - sore but no injuries or swelling!
customer_reviews.author: number16

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable compression socks that really work!
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend these compression socks. Purchased for a family member who works in the hospitality industry and is on her feet all day. She said it makes a difference to how she feels at the end of her work shift. Her legs don't ache and the socks are really comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Brie

customer_reviews.title: practice getting them on
customer_reviews.text: I almost sent them back because they were so hard to get on my husband. He has a bad back and could no way put them on himself. I was determined to be smarter than a pair of socks! I went to u-tube and watched some videos. The one that shows to hold and pull the heel half way out before putting them on worked best for me. It still is a struggle, by it can be done!!! My husband says they make his legs feel better. He suffers with neuropathy. I hand wash and air dry. Definately get the 2 pair package. Happy with the quality, would buy again....Just get your muscles ready!!!
customer_reviews.author: Solara gold

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: At first I was hesitant on purchasing them because of the price. Soon after they arrived they looked shiny and soft. I used these to run a Spartan Run and I must say these were worth the price. I ran through mud & water. Rocks went inside my shoe and I still didn't get blisters. My legs were not sore and I felt good. I highly recommend them. They stay dry and look awesome. Ordering more when I get paid .
customer_reviews.author: Juan Chavez

customer_reviews.title: Nice compression sock for post surgery.
customer_reviews.text: A little on the loose side, but works well! Easy enough to pull on even with post-op pain, carefully. I have to fold down the top because it's a little too long. I've had these for a few years and worn/washed many times. Almost always hang dry. Still in very good condition, but the sole is starting to wear just a little (pilling a little), but thicker so I don't notice it when it's on. I wear a women's 8.5 sneaker & ordered a medium in this sock.
customer_reviews.author: Carpi

customer_reviews.title: Great, quality compression socks
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two brands of compression socks hoping that at least one of them would fit me. This brand fit me perfectly while the others were too big and did not provide adequate compression. The bottom is nicely padded and provides comfort while running. I had absolutely no chafing from these socks after running 21 miles in two days. I usually have trouble with the comfort of the toe seam, but these socks have a flat, fitted toe seam that is very comfortable. The compression feels perfectly distributed and does not loosen after washing.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: To infinity and beyond now....
customer_reviews.text: I travel quite a bit and have flown long distances without compression socks and now after using them, I always will. They really work...wish I would have used them previously. Well made and a leg saver. Tight at first, but then you get used to them. Sizing is pretty accurate as well.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Donlin

customer_reviews.title: These socks are a must have on long airplane flights.
customer_reviews.text: If traveling on long airplane or road trips these are wonderful. Traveled with several companions on over twenty hour plane rides. When we got to our destination our companions ankles and feet were swollen and looked terrible. They had a hard time walking after that many hours in the plane. My friend and I though had no swelling of or lower extremities and could move around fine. These are invaluable if you plan on taking long plane flights around the globe
customer_reviews.author: Miguel P

customer_reviews.title: Good fit
customer_reviews.text: After struggling to get them on and off the first time, I actually read the instructions and they are relatively easy to put on and take off. I don't know a way to gauge how effective they are but I wore them in a 5K (rain & cold for Florida) and I also wore them for working as an usher at the Daytona International Speedway. They seem to help:)
customer_reviews.author: mrric

customer_reviews.title: I must wear compression socks all the time and these are comfortable and suitable for a variety of outfits and occasions
customer_reviews.text: These socks work very well for me. Per my physician, I must wear compression socks all the time and these are comfortable and suitable for a variety of outfits and occasions. I was probably the only woman on the boardwalks in Ocean City, Bethany Beach & Rehoboth wearing any kind of sock or stocking but I did not feel uncomfortable or ridiculous. I choose white which goes with everything. I would caution you choose sizes carefully. I initially chose a medium based on my shoe size (81/2) and my purchase proved too large and loose. I later ordered the small and they are perfect! I wash them daily and they remain crisp and bright!
customer_reviews.author: CBBrown

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: I bought my first pair of these 3 years ago along with some other styles. I have since ditched the other styles and purchase more of these socks. I work 12+ shifts and these are perfect. They don't squeeze too much behind the knee like some other styles but still provide lots of support. My legs definitely feel the difference without them.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Beautifully Made
customer_reviews.text: I was a little disappointed because the original picture with the socks shown was for two pair of socks. Only one came in the package and the documentation showed that it was just one pair. Oh well. They are beautifully made and comfortable. They help keep my legs from feeling tired.
customer_reviews.author: Ron P

customer_reviews.title: Good but not excessive compression
customer_reviews.text: I have now had these for several months. I use them on my work days when I am standing all day. Good but not excessive compression, legs/feet feel WAY better at the end of the day. Fabric is acceptable and have had no issues with construction or durability. For the price when other compression socks can cost a ton more, I don't really see a reason. These are great socks. I have used/tried about 4-5 other sock brands. If they were a lightweight wool, would be even better.
customer_reviews.author: L. Bryant

customer_reviews.title: Great socks that helped reduce swelling in my ankles
customer_reviews.text: Great socks. These socks were recommended to me by my physical therapy while I was going through rehabilitation for a broken ankle. In the first stage of my recovery, my ankle would become very swollen at the end of a day of walking around or right before it would rain or snow. Literally It looked like I was hording a tennis ball in my left ankle Prior to wearing these socks, to reduce the swelling I would have to elevate my ankle all night. After wearing these socks I would not experience any swelling, AT ALL even after walking all day, doing my ankle exercises and even during damp weather.
customer_reviews.author: R. Davies

product_meta.title: Vitalsox Italy, Patented Graduated Compression Circulation Socks, Silver Drysat Series, VT1211 Pairs
product_meta.description:
We have been making compression socks since 1998, Using elastic layers that work perfectly together to stimulate blood flow, improving oxygen delivery to your muscles as it reduces foot and leg swelling, lactic acid production, and cramping.

Designed for running, walking, standing, sitting, gym, yoga, or sleep in them. 

Better circulation equals faster recovery and better performance.

Every style is engineered with technical, sport-specific features, and built with patented fibers developed through years of exhaustive research, increased comfort and performance, 

This lightly padded sock is a perfect match for the demanding athlete but also for the occasional runner seeking a perfect feeling of freedom. 

Bringing together spandex and sport-specific technical fibers with advanced knitting techniques including our patented interlocked diamond pattern to give the ideal fit and support for the most challenging environments.

Dry stat is our exclusive fiber that gives optimum moisture control reducing the growth of bacteria and fungus to promote a healthier environment for your feet by keeping them dry and comfortable. 

Dry feet = Less blisters. Lightly padded at the ball and on top of the foot to promote comfort and eliminate abrasion and foot stress. 
Compression starts mid foot to support arch and plantar fascia. Reduces Injuries - Plantar fasciitis, shin splints, calf cramps, pulled muscles, Achilles and heel cup issues, blisters, blood pooling. Perform
feature_bullets: VITALSOX EXCLUSIVE SILVER DRYSTAT- Vitalsox technical performance material designed using Quick Drying Polypropylene infused with Silver to resist and stop the growth of bacteria and fungus while it repels odor from the socks. Your feet may still smell but your socks will not hold odors, easy care turn inside out and machine wash warm.

BEST COMPRESSION RANGE, Vitalsox uses compression for maximum circulation and comfort this IDEAL range is the most beneficial for Running, Crossfit, Walkers, Pregnancy, Maternity, Vein Support, Marathons, Sports, Gym, Yoga, Spartan, Standing, Working, Sitting, or Sleeping, Always Increasing Stamina and Faster Recovery, For more compression size down one size in the size chart.

THE ONLY PATENTED COMPRESSION- How is it different, it is Graduated Starting at the mid foot for plantar ligament an arch support, our compression is tested individually during manufacturing to the ideal range for MAXIMUM circulation increase. The feet are the furthest point from your heart by increasing fresh oxygenated blood to your damaged tissues by up to 40% FASTER recovery time and athletic performance is enhanced. Maximum Circulation.

4 WAY STRETCH- Try it -pull both directions, if it is shorter in one direction that is only 2 Way Stretch. our socks stretch both directions for consistent compression throughout the entire sock, If they are TOO LONG, just grab both sides of your calves and slide them down to just below your knee. EACH PAIR is hand tested in our factory for performance, they are WASHED in a "chemical free" fabric softener with a nice fresh scent making our socks "Ready to Wear" right out of the box.

100% MADE IN ITALY- SINCE 1998 Vitalsox the leader in technology and REAL tested graduated compression socks. Made from start to finish in our own factory never outsourced to the lowest bidder or built using machines designed for other products with inferior low priced non tested materials. performance does make a difference, GUARANTEED quality that stands out in your sock drawer, in Italy we are proud to make a superior product at a reasonable price. The Best Compression Socks at any price.
